en: Ars Electronica (AT) is project leader of the large cooperation project Digital Art and science network, with partners form Serbia, Slovakia, Spain, UK, Ireland and Slovenia, granted under the Creative Europe Culture Sub-programme.
58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)

Ars Electronica (AT) is project leader of the large cooperation project Digital Art and science network, with partners form Serbia, Slovakia, Spain, UK, Ireland and Slovenia, granted under the Creative Europe Culture Sub-programme.

From left to right: Joe Gerhardt, Maria Ignacia Edwards, Marc-Hector Vanderhaegen

Winners

The Ars Electronica Prize was one of the events of the Ars Electronica Festival for Art, technology and society, that run from 3-7 September 2015 in Linz, Austria.

At this event, the artists who won the residency prize were honoured:

  • Semiconductor, the artistic duo composed of Ruth Jarman and Joe Gerhardt
  • María Ignacia Edwards
